Description: Upper body fragment of Attic red-figured pottery bell- or calyx-krater; the face of a youth looking right remains.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Venit suggests this may be from the second side of 19852, her no. 362: 'the glaze, clay, surface, and potting marks are the same, but the scale of the figure differs.'
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 104 no. 363 pl. 77)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1112)
